item.description:
Boston TechAviv'ers, this month we have the honor of hosting two very special guests:

  • Patrick Larkin - Director of the John Adams Innovation Institute, the economic development division of the Massachusetts Technology Collaborative
  • Gadi Tamari - Chairman of the Board at PeerApp & Board member at SAVANT Systems

Patrick Larkin, will share the Innovation Institute's mission of improving conditions for growth in the Commonwealth's innovation economy and supporting focused economic development projects that enhance innovation and provide for long-term growth of the knowledge economy in all regions of the state. Patrick will cover what options and resources are available for entrepreneurs in Massachusetts, and how to leverage them.

Gadi Tamari, industry veteran (previously the CEO at RADVISION, amongst other key roles) and TechAviv alumni, will share his perspectives as Chairman at PeerApp. Gadi will share what it looks like from the top, and what key take-aways others can learn from the companies he's been involved in, including the very impressive relaunch of PeerApp by Robert Mayer.

NOTE: This is a members only event. You must be on the RSVP list to attend.


Agenda: 

6:30-7:00pm Networking (Light snacks) 

7:00-7:30pm Patrick's Talk & Group Discussion

7:30-8:00pm Gadi's Talk & Group Discussion 

8:00-8:30pm Member Announcements & Networking

 

When & Where: 
MIT 
Building E51 - Room 325 
70 Memorial Drive 
Cambridge, MA

Looking to hire top Israeli talent? 

Post free on the TechAviv Job Board

 

Thanks to our Sponsors: 

The Boston TechAviv Founders Club is made possible because we have great sponsors. Special thanks to: Nixon Peabody and ExchangeGuru!

 

Sponsorship Opportunities 

Please email Gil or Yaron if you are interested or know somebody who is interested in sponsoring the Boston branch or global TechAviv Founders Club.

 

See you soon!
Gil & Yaron 

@giljzim
